title: Upgrade (managed Kubernetes)
content:
This section introduces procedures to upgrade OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT) and the suite deployed on the following platforms: Azure with AKS, AWS with EKS, GCP with GKE, and OpenShift. 

For an overview of the version upgrade process and upgrade best practices, see the Upgrade landing page.  For the list of base versions from which you can upgrade to the current version, see Supported upgrade paths.

Plan for upgrade

Before you start the upgrade process, make sure you have planned for the following dependencies.

Check base version dependency

Make sure that upgrade is supported for the suite version installed in your environment. For the list of supported upgrade versions, see Supported upgrade paths.

Plan OMT upgrade

For seamless operations, OMT version must match the suite version. To ensure this, we recommend that you upgrade OMT and the suite in the same maintenance window. If this is not possible, make sure that you complete the suite upgrade within one week after upgrading OMT.

Upgrade to 26.1

The following table provides the sequence for the upgrade. Make sure you complete the steps in the same order. You may interchange the upgrade order between UD/UCMDB, OO Containerized, and Audit.

Step No. 

Description 
1

Back up your environment.

  • Back up suite data. For details, see Back up suite data.
  • Back up UD/UCMDB. For details, see Back up UD/UCMDB (managed Kubernetes).
  • Back up OO Containerized. For details, see Back up the OO deployment before upgrade.
  • Back up the Audit service and Audit Collector deployments. For details, see the backup steps in Upgrade Audit (managed Kubernetes).
2 Upgrade OMT. For details, see Upgrade OMT. 
3

Update the suite. For details, see Upgrade the suite.
 

Note: If the suite upgrade fails, restore the suite to the old version. For details, see Restore the suite.
4

If you have enabled Software Asset Management, Native SACM, or Cloud Management solution, upgrade UD/UCMDB.

For details, see Upgrade containerized UD/UCMDB. 
5

If you have enabled the Cloud Management solution, upgrade OO Containerized.

For details relevent to you deployment platform, see

  • Upgrade OO Containerized on EKS and AKS 
  • Upgrade OO Containerized on OpenShift
6

If you have enabled the Audit Service capability, upgrade the Audit Service and Audit Collector.

For details, see Upgrade Audit (managed Kubernetes).
Remember to upgrade the Kubernetes cluster to the latest support version. Ensure all upgrade tasks in the list are completed before upgrading the Kubernetes cluster. 

For details, see Upgrade the Kubernetes cluster (managed Kubernetes).
